sentence.Network_en: They were crazed by the famine and pestilence of that bitter winter.

the plague suspect to have-check-up or check-up detention a period of less than 6 days from the day the vessel or aircraft left the pestilence area ;对离船、离航空器的染疫嫌疑人，从船舶、航空器离开疫区的时候算起，实施不超过6日的就地诊验或者留验；

the Synagogue is also empowered to impose fasting in case of a misfortune befalling the people , as pestilence famine , or an evil decree enforced by the ruler of the day .其它一些非强制性的斋戒日﹐都与历史上的不幸事件或祈祷上帝赐福有关﹐例如瘟疫﹑自然灾害和政治迫害。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (also denoting something morally corrupting): from Old French, from Latin pestilentia, based on pestis 'a plague'

entry.def: Pestilence is any disease that spreads quickly and kills large numbers of people.

means.word_mean: 1. any epidemic disease with a high death rate
